intro: Sicyos garcinii, commonly known as the African burr cucumber, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cucurbitaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its hairy, trailing stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are followed by distinctive, spiny, spherical fruits. Its fruit is often used in traditional medicine and as a source of fiber. Sicyos garcinii thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forest edges.
